text.section: In Calvert County, any person, firm or corporation who shall keep, maintain or operate in the county any junkyard, dump, automobile junkyard, automotive dismantler or recycler facility, scrap metal processing facility, outdoor place where old motor vehicles are stored or dismantled, or lot on which refuse, trash or junk is deposited within one hundred (100) feet of any interstate, State or county highway or road shall screen or fence said premises in such manner that they are not visible from any such road or highway.

Any person, firm or corporation who shall violate the provisions of this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be fined not more than one thousand dollars ($1,000.00).

The provisions of this section are deemed supplementary to the authority of the county to regulate the premises herein mentioned by zoning or by the provisions of § 122A of this subtitle or otherwise.

The provisions of this section shall apply to all junkyards, dumps, facilities, automobile junkyards, outdoor places where old motor vehicles are stored or dismantled, or lots on which refuse, trash or junk is deposited, created after June 1, 1967, and shall also apply to all such places 18 months after June 1, 1967.
